page.title: 08NEWSPAPER HEADLINES
page.content: { Bradford fund raising continued. Over 50 people were killed. {Goodbye Mr.Mayor. Outgoing Mayor Fred Perham kept a promise when he fulfilled his final engagement as first Citizen of St.Albans on Wednesday.Mr Perham visited Maple J.M.I. School in Hall Place Gardens to thank the children who raised Â£800 for the Ethiopean Appeal for the starving people. {************************************* These are the programmes from Tuesday May 21sts Mid Herts Citizen.On B.B.C.1 At 5.35pm Dr.Kildare. 6.00pm Six,o,clock news followed Weather News.6.35pm News Magazine.7.00pm EastEnders.7.30pm No Place Like Home. 8.00pm The day the universe changed. B.B.C.2 5.35pm Play Golf.6.00pm Laramie.6.50pm Off The Record.7.00pm Whistle Test.I.T.V 9.00pm Quincy.
